verses.verse: And Moses <WH4872> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559> But, behold, <WH2005> they will not <WH3808> believe <WH539> me, nor <WH3808> hearken <WH8085> unto my voice: <WH6963> for <WH3588> they will say, <WH559> The LORD <WH3068> hath not <WH3808> appeared <WH7200> unto <WH413> thee.
And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto <WH413> him, What is that <WH4100> <WH2088> in thine hand? <WH3027> And he said, <WH559> A rod. <WH4294>

And he said, <WH559> Cast <WH7993> it on the ground. <WH776> And he cast <WH7993> it on the ground, <WH776> and it became <WH1961> a serpent; <WH5175> and Moses <WH4872> fled <WH5127> from before <WH4480> <WH6440> it.

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto <WH413> Moses, <WH4872> Put forth <WH7971> thine hand, <WH3027> and take <WH270> it by the tail. <WH2180> And he put forth <WH7971> his hand, <WH3027> and caught <WH2388> it, and it became <WH1961> a rod <WH4294> in his hand: <WH3709>

That <WH4616> they may believe <WH539> that <WH3588> the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of their fathers, <WH1> the God <WH430> of Abraham, <WH85> the God <WH430> of Isaac, <WH3327> and the God <WH430> of Jacob, <WH3290> hath appeared <WH7200> unto <WH413> thee.

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> furthermore <WH5750> unto him, Put <WH935> now <WH4994> thine hand <WH3027> into thy bosom. <WH2436> And he put <WH935> his hand <WH3027> into his bosom: <WH2436> and when he took it out, <WH3318> behold, <WH2009> his hand <WH3027> was leprous <WH6879> as snow. <WH7950>

And he said, <WH559> Put <WH7725> thine hand <WH3027> into <WH413> thy bosom <WH2436> again. And he put <WH7725> his hand <WH3027> into <WH413> his bosom <WH2436> again; and plucked it out <WH3318> of his bosom, <WH4480> <WH2436> and, behold, <WH2009> it was turned again <WH7725> as his other flesh. <WH1320>

And it shall come to pass, <WH1961> if <WH518> they will not <WH3808> believe <WH539> thee, neither <WH3808> hearken <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of the first <WH7223> sign, <WH226> that they will believe <WH539> the voice <WH6963> of the latter <WH314> sign. <WH226>

And it shall come to pass, <WH1961> if <WH518> they will not <WH3808> believe <WH539> also <WH1571> these <WH428> two <WH8147> signs, <WH226> neither <WH3808> hearken <WH8085> unto thy voice, <WH6963> that thou shalt take <WH3947> of the water <WH4480> <WH4325> of the river, <WH2975> and pour <WH8210> it upon the dry <WH3004> land: and the water <WH4325> which <WH834> thou takest <WH3947> out of <WH4480> the river <WH2975> shall become <WH1961> blood <WH1818> upon the dry <WH3006> land.

And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> unto <WH413> the LORD, <WH3068> O <WH994> my Lord, <WH136> I <WH595> am not <WH3808> eloquent, <WH376> <WH1697> neither <WH1571> heretofore, <WH4480> <WH8543> <WH1571> <WH4480> <WH8032> nor <WH1571> since <WH4480> <WH227> thou hast spoken <WH1696> unto <WH413> thy servant: <WH5650> but <WH3588> I <WH595> am slow <WH3515> of speech, <WH6310> and of a slow <WH3515> tongue. <WH3956>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto <WH413> him, Who <WH4310> hath made <WH7760> man's <WH120> mouth? <WH6310> or <WH176> who <WH4310> maketh <WH7760> the dumb, <WH483> or <WH176> deaf, <WH2795> or <WH176> the seeing, <WH6493> or <WH176> the blind? <WH5787> have not <WH3808> I <WH595> the LORD? <WH3068>
Now <WH6258> therefore go, <WH1980> and I <WH595> will be <WH1961> with <WH5973> thy mouth, <WH6310> and teach <WH3384> thee what <WH834> thou shalt say. <WH1696>
And he said, <WH559> O <WH994> my Lord, <WH136> send, <WH7971> I pray thee, <WH4994> by the hand <WH3027> of him whom thou wilt send. <WH7971>

And the anger <WH639> of the LORD <WH3068> was kindled <WH2734> against Moses, <WH4872> and he said, <WH559> Is not <WH3808> Aaron <WH175> the Levite <WH3881> thy brother? <WH251> I know <WH3045> that <WH3588> he <WH1931> can speak well. <WH1696> <WH1696> And also, <WH1571> behold, <WH2009> he <WH1931> cometh forth <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> thee: and when he seeth <WH7200> thee, he will be glad <WH8055> in his heart. <WH3820>

And thou shalt speak <WH1696> unto <WH413> him, and put <WH7760> <WH853> words <WH1697> in his mouth: <WH6310> and I <WH595> will be <WH1961> with <WH5973> thy mouth, <WH6310> and with <WH5973> his mouth, <WH6310> and will teach <WH3384> you <WH853> what <WH834> ye shall do. <WH6213>

And he <WH1931> shall be thy spokesman <WH1696> unto <WH413> the people: <WH5971> and he shall be, <WH1961> even he <WH1931> shall be <WH1961> to thee instead of a mouth, <WH6310> and thou <WH859> shalt be <WH1961> to him instead of God. <WH430>
And thou shalt take <WH3947> this <WH2088> rod <WH4294> in thine hand, <WH3027> wherewith <WH834> thou shalt do <WH6213> <WH853> signs. <WH226>

And Moses <WH4872> went <WH1980> and returned <WH7725> to <WH413> Jethro <WH3503> his father-in-law, <WH2859> and said <WH559> unto him, Let me go, <WH1980> I pray thee, <WH4994> and return <WH7725> unto <WH413> my brethren <WH251> which <WH834> are in Egypt, <WH4714> and see <WH7200> whether they be yet <WH5750> alive. <WH2416> And Jethro <WH3503> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> Go <WH1980> in peace. <WH7965>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto <WH413> Moses <WH4872> in Midian, <WH4080> Go, <WH1980> return <WH7725> into Egypt: <WH4714> for <WH3588> all <WH3605> the men <WH376> are dead <WH4191> which sought <WH1245> <WH853> thy life. <WH5315>

And Moses <WH4872> took <WH3947> <WH853> his wife <WH802> and his sons, <WH1121> and set <WH7392> them upon <WH5921> an ass, <WH2543> and he returned <WH7725> to the land <WH776> of Egypt: <WH4714> and Moses <WH4872> took <WH3947> <WH853> the rod <WH4294> of God <WH430> in his hand. <WH3027>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto <WH413> Moses, <WH4872> When thou goest <WH1980> to return <WH7725> into Egypt, <WH4714> see <WH7200> that thou do <WH6213> all <WH3605> those wonders <WH4159> before <WH6440> Pharaoh, <WH6547> which <WH834> I have put <WH7760> in thine hand: <WH3027> but I <WH589> will harden <WH2388> <WH853> his heart, <WH3820> that he shall not <WH3808> let <WH853> the people <WH5971> go. <WH7971>
And thou shalt say <WH559> unto <WH413> Pharaoh, <WH6547> Thus <WH3541> saith <WH559> the LORD, <WH3068> Israel <WH3478> is my son, <WH1121> even my firstborn: <WH1060>

And I say <WH559> unto <WH413> thee, Let <WH853> my son <WH1121> go, <WH7971> that he may serve <WH5647> me: and if thou refuse <WH3985> to let him go, <WH7971> behold, <WH2009> I <WH595> will slay <WH2026> <WH853> thy son, <WH1121> even thy firstborn. <WH1060>
And it came to pass <WH1961> by the way <WH1870> in the inn, <WH4411> that the LORD <WH3068> met <WH6298> him, and sought <WH1245> to kill <WH4191> him.

Then Zipporah <WH6855> took <WH3947> a sharp stone, <WH6864> and cut off <WH3772> <WH853> the foreskin <WH6190> of her son, <WH1121> and cast <WH5060> it at his feet, <WH7272> and said, <WH559> Surely <WH3588> a bloody <WH1818> husband <WH2860> art thou <WH859> to me.
So he let him go: <WH7503> <WH4480> then <WH227> she said, <WH559> A bloody <WH1818> husband <WH2860> thou art, because of the circumcision. <WH4139>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to <WH413> Aaron, <WH175> Go <WH1980> into the wilderness <WH4057> to meet <WH7125> Moses. <WH4872> And he went, <WH1980> and met <WH6298> him in the mount <WH2022> of God, <WH430> and kissed <WH5401> him.

And Moses <WH4872> told <WH5046> Aaron <WH175> <WH853> all <WH3605> the words <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068> who <WH834> had sent <WH7971> him, and all <WH3605> the signs <WH226> which <WH834> he had commanded <WH6680> him.
And Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175> went <WH1980> and gathered together <WH622> <WH853> all <WH3605> the elders <WH2205> of the children <WH1121> of Israel: <WH3478>

And Aaron <WH175> spoke <WH1696> <WH853> all <WH3605> the words <WH1697> which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> had spoken <WH1696> unto <WH413> Moses, <WH4872> and did <WH6213> the signs <WH226> in the sight <WH5869> of the people. <WH5971>

And the people <WH5971> believed: <WH539> and when they heard <WH8085> that <WH3588> the LORD <WH3068> had visited <WH6485> <WH853> the children <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> and that <WH3588> he had looked upon <WH7200> <WH853> their affliction, <WH6040> then they bowed their heads <WH6915> and worshiped. <WH7812>
